title: New America (organization) - Wikipedia
snippet: New America was founded in 1999 by Ted Halstead, Sherle Schwenninger, Michael Lind, and Walter Russell Mead as the New America Foundation.

title: New America (New America Foundation) - InfluenceWatch - InfluenceWatch
snippet: Ted Halstead founded New America and was president and CEO from 1999-2007. Halstead convinced liberal commentator Bill Moyers, the former press secretary for President Lyndon Johnson, to back the project.

title: New America Foundation - MacArthur Foundation
snippet: Founded in 1999, New America Foundation (New America) has dedicated itself to renewing, reimagining, and realizing the promise of America in an era of rapid technological and social change. New America envisions a fully representative, responsive, creative and inclusive democracy that fosters thriving human potential, economic security, innovation, and sustainability around the globe.

title: New America (organization)
snippet: New America was established in 1999 by Ted Halstead as a nonprofit think tank dedicated to fostering innovative policy ideas and amplifying emerging voices in American public discourse, with a focus on addressing challenges in technology, economics, ...
